text:
A company may have any number of directors on its board. Companies often have
directors with expertise in specific areas of the firm's business, such as risk management,
finance, or industry strategy. In a one-tier board, there is a single board of directors that
includes both internal and external directors. Internal directors (also called executive
directors) are typically senior managers employed by the firm. External board members
(also called non-executive directors) are those who are not company management.
Non-executive directors who have no other relationship with the company are termed
independent directors. Employee board representatives may be a significant portion of
the non-executive directors.
